title: Orcas: Apex Predators Or Marine Park Stars?
description: NPR science correspondent Lauren Sommer joins Short Wave host Emily Kwong to talk about a team of researchers who were the first to document a pack of orcas attacking a blue whale.  Their work shows that killer whales, while stars in marine parks and movies, are also the ocean's top-- and often vicious-- predators.  Humans' complex relationship with them may say more about humans than about the orcas.

itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: NPR science correspondent Lauren Sommer joins Short Wave to talk about the role orcas occupy in the human imagination, as both marine park favorites and apex predators.
